National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Shipping; Road Transport and Highways) #-5 wa 6, #rr-10, HHT, fc-110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-1O, Dwarka; New Delhl-110075 No.; 11041/21/2002-Admn: June 2006 POLICY MATTERS: TECHNICAL (67/2006) [Decision taken on EW Division's file No. NHAHTTech/RajAward/2o04] Sub:: Evaluation of bid capacity for EPC Contracts (NHAI funded)-reg: In accordance with tha decision taken in one of the weekly meetings, the Work awarded to a Concessionaire under PPP Scheme (BOTIBOT(Annuity)) is generally not being considered in determining bid capacity for NHAI projects. In order to have unifom guidelines, it may be noted that for all future projects, while determining whether 3 Contractor has adequate bid capacity, the works   awarded to Contractor as Concessionaire under PPP Schere should not be considered as work in hand. This is because under PPP Scheme, the Concessionaire can these works executed through any EPC Contractor: Further; the funds are   arranged   through financial institutions before achieving Financial Close for that particular project As such; the projects under PPP Scheme need not be considered as a liability (work in hand) while determining the bid capacity.
